DOC.brief_summary: Objective : To determine effectiveness capacitive diathermy mechanosensitivity , morphological , functional contractility change patient lumbopelvic pain . Design : A pilot study , single blind , randomize control clinical trial , approve previously The Princess University Hospital Ethics Committee ( Feb 11 , 2016 ) European University clinical intervention review board ( CIPI/054/15 ) . Setting : Faculty Health Sciences , Exercise Sport . European University Madrid . Patients intervention : A sample 20 patient bilateral lumbopelvic pain , 18 60 year old , recruit randomized 2 intervention group . The instrumental manual therapy switch capacitive diathermy electrode ( IMT+ T-CaRe®on ; n = 10 ) instrumental manual therapy switch capacitive diathermy electrode ( IMT+ T-CaRe®off ; n = 10 ) bilaterally treat 4 week ( 1 treatment per week 10 minute ) lumbopelvic region . Outcome measurement : Control variables age , sex , height , weight , body mass index , Borg scale physical activity distress respiratory test measure begin treatment . Dependent variable pain intensity , pressure pain threshold , contractility , stiffness , adverse effect , Oswestry Schöber test , well ultrasound image cross sectional area thickness skin , subcutaneous tissue , connective tissue , L4 multifidus abdominal Wall ( rectus anterior , externus oblique , internal oblique transversus abdominis ) assess intervention blind examiner . Analysis data : The statistical analysis perform 95 % confidence interval Statistic Package Social Sciences ( SPSS ) 22.0 .
DOC.criteria: bilateral lumbopelvic pain 6 week neuromuscular condition negative straight leg raise test respiratory congenital condition surgery neurologic sign low extremity condition skin alteration cognitive disorder body mass index higher 31 kg/cm2 skin alteration pregnancy intensive physical activity Nijmegen test high 24
